name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. William M. VILLA, Appellee

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. William M. VILLA, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Based upon our disposition in Commonwealth v. Williams, 557 Pa. 285, 733 A.2d 593 (1999), we affirm the Order of the Lancaster County Court of Common Pleas dated May 20, 1999. Furthermore, we remand the matter to the common pleas court for disposition of any remaining issues.
Jurisdiction is relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Joseph C. Madenspacher, Dist. Atty., Susan E. Moyer, Asst. Dist. Atty., District Attorney’s Office, for Com.
James J. Karl, Sam Encarnación, Lancaster, Public Defender’s Office, for William M. Villa.
casebody.head_matter:
734 A.2d 1287
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. William M. VILLA, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Aug. 11, 1999.
Decided Sept. 9, 1999.
Joseph C. Madenspacher, Dist. Atty., Susan E. Moyer, Asst. Dist. Atty., District Attorney’s Office, for Com.
James J. Karl, Sam Encarnación, Lancaster, Public Defender’s Office, for William M. Villa.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
